title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
Orum is making sales human again through conversations. We are an AI-driven, live conversation platform that accelerates sales teams by empowering salespeople to achieve more. Orum increases sales efficiency, speeds up pipeline growth, and lowers customer acquisition costs for various companies ranging in size from start-ups to large enterprises. Sales teams using Orum see consistent conversations, more meetings booked, and shorter rep ramp time - all while having fun and not burning out. We are beyond excited to hire an empowered, remote-first community to support Orum's next growth phase!

Our Mission is to accelerate sales teams by empowering salespeople to achieve more.
Our Vision is to be an iconic company that makes work more human, meaningful, and connected.

The Staff Software Engineer role is ideal if you like to work across the stack to deliver significant impact while setting an example for and mentoring other members of the team. You'll be in charge of building and owning features end-to-end from conception to implementation, shipping, and iteration. Examples include routing calls through our event-based SIP Softswitch, displaying real-time call information in our UI over WebSockets, or processing streaming audio for speech recognition.

Our current technology stack includes NodeJS with Typescript, Ruby, Postgres, Google Cloud Platform, and FreeSWITCH.

Candidates must be based in the USA or Canada. This position is not open to other countries at this time.

Salary: The base salary range is $200,000 - $220,000. If you're selected, we'll make an offer within this range that matches the experience you're coming with. We respect your time and don't intend to waste it.

Please keep reading...
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized candidates tend to only apply when they check every box. We don’t want you to look at each of the points to figure out whether or not you’re qualified. But if you think the gestalt of it describes you, we’d love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

title: Software Engineer
description:
👋🏽 Hello, we’re Pomelo

We’re an early-stage startup on a mission to reinvent money transfer. Think immigrants in the US who send money to their families back home.

Traditional money transfer companies charge hefty fees to send money. The World Bank reports that remitters lose 6% today to fees and exchange rate markups.

Pomelo fixes this by using the power of credit. Instead of sending cash overseas, consumers in the US can apply for our Pomelo Mastercard and give their loved ones overseas access to their credit — for free.

Instead of charging our customers, we make money from interchange, like most other credit cards. This puts money back in the hands of the people who need it most — our customers.

We have a host of other benefits, like making money transfer safer too (no more carrying or picking up cash), and helping immigrants build their credit when they don’t have great credit today. Read more about us here:

• Our website, particularly our FAQs
• Our launch blog post from our founder & CEO

As of August 2022, we’re a distributed/remote team of ~20, and we’re hiring across the US. We’ve raised $20M in venture capital to date (along with a $50M warehouse facility), and our investors include Keith Rabois (former COO of Square), Kevin Hartz (co-founder of Xoom), The Chainsmokers, and The Weeknd!

We’re hiring

We’re a small team of <10 engineers today, and we’re looking for 2-3 more engineers to join us on our journey. We’re still early-stage, so if working on a small team with lots of ownership, responsibility, and impact excites you, keep reading. =)

Our tech stack today is primarily:

• Java, Postgres, and AWS on the backend
• TypeScript, React, and React Native on the frontend

We care less about experience with these specific technologies and more about experience building, shipping, and iterating on production apps and services in general.

We’re similarly open to both engineers who specialize in backend or frontend and engineers who prefer to work full-stack; our goal is to build a diverse team with complementary skill sets.

The work

Regardless of specialization, you’ll be given major problems to solve, and significant ownership in solving them. Examples of problems you might get to work on include:

• 📈 Growth. Deeply understand our end-to-end acquisition funnel, work with our peers in product and marketing to identify opportunities for impact, and then make them happen! Success is measured directly through conversions and retention.

  ↪ Recent examples here include shipping a web version of our signup flow (originally mobile-only), iterating on our credit underwriting model (to expand access to our product), and building out a significant promotional exchange rates feature (making us significantly better than the market).

• ✨ Quality and delight. Our success as a company will be determined in large part by the quality of the product we provide to our customers and how delighted we make them feel. (Word of mouth is the number one way most money transfer services spread.) What feedback are we hearing from customers and customer service? Where are we falling short, and where can we go above and beyond?

 ↪ Recent examples here include integrating with a courier service in the Philippines for fast and reliable card delivery overseas, and implementing an international security standard (3DSecure) for immediate “virtual card” support (our first magic moment).

• 🛠 Infra and tools. We take pride in our craft, and we value our time, so we regularly build infrastructure and tooling that makes us more effective or saves us time.

 ↪ Recent examples here include a whole internal admin app for customer support and operations (we use Retool for this today), analytics & experimentation infra to let us test, measure, and learn (we use Segment, Mixpanel, and LaunchDarkly today), and continuous deployment infra for our website (automatically shipping to production on every merge to main, with preview deployments on every PR).

We work in cross-functional “squads” and collaborate both within and outside of eng. We operate in sprints and try to ship and demo something meaningful every week. And besides daily standups and weekly all-hands, we try to leave most time unscheduled, so the focus can be on the work and the problems above.

The requirements

We know that women and minorities read lists of requirements and consider themselves unqualified if they don’t meet every single one.

So rather than list every possible thing we might want to see, below are the things that are most important to us:

• Genuine interest in our mission, and genuine desire to have real-world impact. We’re too small and early today to support engineers who are only interested in deep technical problems, for example.

• Ability and readiness to work in an early-stage startup. You have experience working in ambiguous environments, defining or clarifying requirements yourself. You’ve taken initiative and ownership in solving problems, not just implementing solutions.

• Solid technical proficiency in your area of expertise. You’re capable of independently building meaningful apps or services, and have experience shipping and iterating on them in production.

• Effective communication and collaboration skills. You’re able to clearly convey technical concepts and tradeoffs to non-technical audiences, and you have past experience working with others outside of engineering.

All of the above is more important to us than specific years of experience, but we expect most engineers to need at least a few years in the industry to gain this experience.

We’re open to both mid-level engineers (e.g. 2-4 years of experience) and more senior engineers (e.g. 5+ years of experience) today. We hope to support engineers earlier in their career in the future as we grow.

Our culture and values

We’re a fintech startup, and we’re a remote-first company. These things have shaped our culture and values. Below are our values:

1. Earn the trust of our customers. As a startup, our customers come first, and as a fintech startup, their trust in us is paramount. We don’t take the opportunity to serve them for granted.

2. Be relentless. Startups are hard and filled with adversity. We persevere through challenges, focus on impact, and strive to always be shipping, learning, and improving.

3. Integrity in every language. We strive to always do what’s right, both for ourselves and for our customers around the globe.

4. Show your work. Successful teams run on trust, and proactive transparency builds trust. We love holding ourselves accountable by openly sharing our progress, and we love empowering engineers by openly sharing business context. We also document extensively, to help us work remotely more effectively.

5. Leadership at every level. We want every engineer to own whole problems and feel empowered to go wherever those problems take them. We also aim to lift others up and make others better.

Benefits and perks

Here are the biggest things we believe we have to offer:

❤️ A truly meaningful mission and an opportunity for direct social impact. We’re aiming to put real money back in the hands of the people who need it most and help immigrants and their families realize the American dream.

👥 An amazing team and culture (see our values above). You’ll have peers from both top tech companies (e.g. Google, Twitter, Microsoft) and other successful startups (e.g. Affirm, Remitly, MemSQL). We’ll both empower you and challenge you to do great work, in a great environment, alongside great people.

🤝🏽 Opportunity for direct experience, learning, and growth. You won’t be a cog in a wheel here; you’ll be given major problems to solve and the ownership to solve them. Whether you hope to start your own startup someday or become a more capable engineer, the experience you gain here will help you achieve your career goals faster.

We hope you join us for those reasons and not for money, prestige, or the allure of working at a startup. Startups are hard, and success for an early-stage startup like us may still be years away.

Fortunately, we also value enjoying the journey, so we also happily offer:

💸 Competitive salary. You won’t be sacrificing significant cash to take a bet on us. We also calibrate our salaries to the market to prevent wage gaps for women and minorities.

📈 Significant equity. Successful companies in our space are valued at billions of dollars, so our upside potential is high. If you’re excited to bet on us, we’re excited to share in the rewards if we succeed.

🏥 Platinum-level health insurance (medical, dental, vision) — with 99% covered by the company for you and 50% for dependents.

🌴 Real, guaranteed PTO (we don’t say “unlimited” PTO then make you feel bad for taking any): 3 weeks in your first year, 4 weeks thereafter. We even go a step further and offer a…

✈️ $1,500 annual travel stipend — to encourage you to take time off and truly disconnect and recharge. You have no excuse not to now. =)

😌 $300 annual wellness stipend, to help you stay physically, emotionally, and mentally healthy, any way you choose.

🖥 $500 home office setup stipend, to help you do great work. This is in addition to us already providing things like a top-of-the-line laptop and monitor on us.

🗺 Twice-a-year company retreats, with potentially more frequent engineering team meetups, covered by the company. We’ve found this to be a great way to spend in-person time together while still getting the benefits of working remotely otherwise.

Next steps

If all of the above sounds exciting to you, we encourage you to apply! You have nothing to lose, and we’ll get back to you quickly.

If we move forward, our typical interview process is as follows:

1. 30-minute recruiter call. We’ll get to know each other at a high level, cover logistics and expectations, and answer any general questions you may have!

2. 30-minute manager call. We’ll dig more into your technical background and values, and answer any engineering-related questions you may have.

3. 1-hour collaborative coding exercise. This’ll be with a Pomelo engineer over screenshare. This’ll be a data structures problem, but we don’t do fancy or tricky algorithms; this problem tries to be real-world.

4. 3-4 hour virtual onsite! You’ll get to meet more of our team, and a typical interview loop covers system design/architecture, cross-functional collaboration, and values alignment — no whiteboard coding.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: AI Software Systems Engineer
description:
This is an opportunity to join the Software Systems Engineering team to participate in building the Zoox robotaxi, the first in the world that has operated on public roads. The Software Systems Engineering team is responsible for defining SW development processes and ensuring that all safety-critical software meets a high safety bar for production vehicles.

In this role, you will collaborate with the AI software teams (perception, planner, and teleoperations) and safety team to ensure the developed software meets the targeted safety integrity level.

title: Embedded Software Engineer - Platforms
description: Zoox is looking for an embedded software engineer to join our Firmware Platforms team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing, extending, and maintaining support for multiple embedded platforms for the Zoox vehicle. You will work closely with electrical engineers, embedded software engineers, and validation engineers to enable support for new advanced platforms and accelerate application development across multiple projects. We are looking for people who are passionate about diving deep into the hardware and creating robust and reusable software.

title: Embedded Software Engineer - Returnship
description:
The Path Forward Return to Work program at Zoox is a 16-week paid returnship for experienced professionals returning to the workforce. The program is open to individuals who have at least 5 years of professional experience and have been out of the paid workforce for at least two years to focus on caregiving of any kind. If you meet these criteria, we welcome you to apply.  

At Zoox, we are excited to be part of the Path Forward program because we appreciate the skills you can offer, the perspective you provide, and the contributions you will make. This program offers you a chance to revamp your skills, gain new experience, and make connections with others transitioning back to the workforce. It also offers support through Path Forward, a nonprofit organization on a mission to empower people who’ve been focused on caregiving to transition back to the paid workforce.  

Our Firmware team is responsible for embedded software development, extensions, and maintenance for multiple embedded platforms for the Zoox vehicle. This encompasses “car-like” driving functions, newer “robot-like” user interactions and functions, foundational board development, and more. 

We are looking for people who are passionate about diving deep into technical problems and creating robust and reusable software. We are looking broadly for contributions ranging from developing features; essential software infrastructure; and extensive, insightful automated verification and validation.

title: Full-stack Software Engineer - Fleet Management Tools
description: Zoox’s fleet management application is an essential tool in the operation of our ever-growing fleet of autonomous robotaxis. We build tools to interact with and monitor our vehicles remotely: everything from in-the-field diagnostics to step-function operational improvements like remote software deploy and automated scheduling. If you’re excited about building world-class web applications that make a real difference in people’s lives, this position is for you!

title: Full-stack Software Engineer - Garage Tools
description: Zoox’s L5 robot tools are an integral part of the day-to-day operation of our fleet of purpose built autonomous robotaxis. As an engineer on our L5 Robot Tools team, you will collaborate with industry leaders in robotics, vehicle development and operations to simplify and expedite the operation and development of our fully custom robot. This role is well suited for anyone who thrives in ambiguity, has experience in multiple domains and has a willingness to learn AV-specific concepts. If you have a passion for working directly with users on R&D platforms, this is the role for you.

title: Hardware Software Integration Engineer
description:
Zoox's Hardware Software Integration team is responsible for ensuring various hardware subsystems work reliably on our vehicle platform on a day-to-day basis.  As an hardware/software integration engineer, you will oversee the deployment of next-generation compute, sensor and data networking systems for autonomous vehicles.  

This role is essential and fundamental to the execution stage of Zoox's vehicle program, ensuring that hardware systems operate predictably at all times. This team is the first line of defense for any issues with our vehicle fleet. We are looking for someone with excellent communication skills who is excited about being the first responder to triage and debug difficult HW/SW integration issues. The team is also responsible for supporting bring up and manufacturing operations for the vehicle.

title: Manager, Mapping Data Software
description:
Our Calibration, Localization, and Mapping (CLAMS) team is responsible for building the algorithms and tools necessary for keeping Zoox vehicles well calibrated, always knowing where they’re located within the world, and aware of their environment. Without precise calibration, localization, and mapping our vehicles would be at a disadvantage when it comes to perceiving and reasoning about the surrounding world, and is therefore foundational in enabling results from many other teams across Zoox. This work is critical for scaling autonomous driving in a safe and reliable way. 

We are looking for engineers who are ambitious and excited about helping Zoox deliver on its goals to deliver autonomous mobility. The Mapping Data Publishing, Access, Deployment, and Scaling (Data PADS) team is responsible for how data is created, maintained, accessed, and deployed on-vehicle. The team forms the foundational requirements and design architecture of the data pipelines across the department. Data PADS works with the Calibration, Localization, and Mapping verticals to set a high bar for data integrity and scalability.

title: Manager, Software Integration Test
description:
Autonomous vehicles have some of the largest, most complex software ever shipped in a safety-critical environment. Solving that problem is one of the most exciting technical challenges of our lifetime.

As an Engineering Manager supporting the integration, test, and release of software, you will help accelerate our product development by leading a team of test engineers to deploy the most reliable and safe autonomous driving software possible. As developers build new features, you and your team will develop extensive test plans, design system integration tests to execute different scenarios, measure system performance, and triage issues seen during on-vehicle and offline testing. These efforts are critical to maintaining the quality of code in the main repository with no regressions to safety or driving characteristics. You will be required to create opportunities to automate testing and optimize development and test processes, perform code reviews and enforce best coding practices.

You will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally across the Software organization, making contributions to directly impact and improve developer productivity, working closely with release engineering, infrastructure, and platform test teams. Your ability to understand the overall system design and component interaction to help guide test methodology for functional and safety sign-off will be crucial for the success of this role.

title: Manager, Software Integration Test
description:
Autonomous vehicles have some of the largest, most complex software ever shipped in a safety-critical environment. Solving that problem is one of the most exciting technical challenges of our lifetime.

As an Engineering Manager supporting the integration, test, and release of software, you will help accelerate our product development by leading a team of test engineers to deploy the most reliable and safe autonomous driving software possible. As developers build new features, you and your team will develop extensive test plans, design system integration tests to execute different scenarios, measure system performance, and triage issues seen during on-vehicle and offline testing. These efforts are critical to maintaining the quality of code in the main repository with no regressions to safety or driving characteristics. You will be required to create opportunities to automate testing and optimize development and test processes, perform code reviews and enforce best coding practices.

You will have the opportunity to work cross-functionally across the Software organization, making contributions to directly impact and improve developer productivity, working closely with release engineering, infrastructure, and platform test teams. Your ability to understand the overall system design and component interaction to help guide test methodology for functional and safety sign-off will be crucial for the success of this role.

title: Manager, Software Systems Infrastructure
description:
The Software Systems Infrastructure team is responsible for defining SW development processes and ensuring that all safety-critical software meets a high safety bar for production vehicles.

 In this role, you will lead the software engineering team responsible for the establishment of infrastructure and the design and development of software tools. These tools will automate, track or audit processes and methods needed to build safety-critical software.  

Borrowing principles from avionics, automotive, and other safety-critical industries, your team will support software- and systems engineers across the Zoox software organization, ranging from state-of-the-art AI Perception, all the way to highly-critical RTOS and middleware components.

title: Senior/ Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Workload Orchestration
description:
Come join us at Zoox to participate in the transportation revolution with building self-driving vehicles! Our mission is to make personal transportation safer, cleaner, and more enjoyable for everyone. Simulation is essential to Zoox’s mission. Zoox uses simulation to develop our driving software, validate safety, and analyze our real-world performance. Our team’s work directly impacts how rapidly and successfully Zoox will achieve its goals.
 
We are looking for experienced developers (5+ years experience) to build a massively scalable pipeline for orchestrating the execution of simulations and processing of the results. This mission critical pipeline will be highly parallel, manage various stages of execution, ensure correct data flow and coordinate the processing of the results. This is an ideal opportunity for an innovative Software Engineer to build the foundation and the pipeline that can exponentially scale up the execution of the simulations and at the same time meet the diverse needs of processing the results.

title: Senior/Staff Android Software Engineer - Tablet
description: Zoox is looking for a seasoned Android Engineer to join the In-Vehicle Experience Engineering team. The position comes with a high degree of independence and the opportunity to help shape our In-Vehicle rider experience roadmap. Your work will be highly visible, at the forefront of our service rollout. In your development work, and in interactions with infrastructure teams, we will expect you to be essential in establishing practices and interfaces that result in a robust, usable, and secure system: from Rider, to AWS Cloud, to Zoox’s self-driving vehicle.

title: Senior/Staff Embedded Software Engineer - Drive Systems
description: Zoox is looking for an embedded software engineer to join our Firmware Drive Systems team. In this role, you will be responsible for embedded software development for the driving-related functions and sub-systems of the Zoox vehicle. This work includes throttle, braking, steering, a variety of operator controls, integration of supplier systems, coordination and control of all driving sub-systems, and low-level vehicle controls. You will work closely with vehicle engineers, systems engineers, controls engineers, and suppliers to ensure the Zoox vehicle can drive safely and reliably. We are looking for people who are passionate about working with hardware and developing production-quality code for complex dynamic systems.

title: Senior/Staff Embedded Software Engineer - Firmware Architecture
description:
About the Role
The Firmware Architecture team at Zoox is responsible for guiding the development of our embedded systems and the firmware that makes them tick. Our team collaborates with other firmware, hardware, software, systems, and safety teams across Zoox to build complex systems designed for challenging automotive environments.

Together with the team, you will define the firmware architecture of our embedded systems and work with our cross-functional partners to drive the development of our next-generation robot. We are looking for a firmware engineer who is excited to work across our entire stack, loves to learn new things, and likes to take ownership of major components. If you like to drive the design and development of complex embedded systems, we would like to hear from you.

title: Senior/Staff Embedded Software Engineer - Firmware Architecture
description:
About the Role
The Firmware Architecture team at Zoox is responsible for guiding the development of our embedded systems and the firmware that makes them tick. Our team collaborates with other firmware, hardware, software, systems, and safety teams across Zoox to build complex systems designed for challenging automotive environments.

Together with the team, you will define the firmware architecture of our embedded systems and work with our cross-functional partners to drive the development of our next-generation robot. We are looking for a firmware engineer who is excited to work across our entire stack, loves to learn new things, and likes to take ownership of major components. If you like to drive the design and development of complex embedded systems, we would like to hear from you.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - 3D World Generation
description:
The Zoox simulation team is looking for experienced software engineers to take our 3D world-generation technology to the next level. You will work closely with technical artists to improve our content pipeline and with simulation/graphics engineers to improve the runtime fidelity and performance of our 3D worlds. 

Join us to improve our critical pipelines and graphics stack and to help realize safe, enjoyable autonomous driving for everyone.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - 3D World Generation
description:
The Zoox simulation team is looking for experienced software engineers to take our 3D world-generation technology to the next level. You will work closely with technical artists to improve our content pipeline and with simulation/graphics engineers to improve the runtime fidelity and performance of our 3D worlds. 

Join us to improve our critical pipelines and graphics stack and to help realize safe, enjoyable autonomous driving for everyone.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Android AOSP System Engineer
description: Zoox is looking for a seasoned Android (AOSP) embedded systems engineer to join the Software Engineering team. The position comes with a high degree of independence and the opportunity to drive custom In-Vehicle infotainment device solutions. Your work will be highly visible, at the forefront of our service rollout as the primary on-vehicle interaction point with our future riders. In your development work, and in interactions with software, infrastructure, hardware and supplier teams, we will expect you to be essential in establishing best practices and creating interfaces that result in a robust and secure system.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Backend, Developer Platforms
description:
Delivering Zoox's mission of autonomous mobility primarily involves two stages - validating software in simulation before testing it in the real world and gathering insights from the data collected after real-world testing. The grand goal of the Developer Platforms team is to help developers at Zoox validate and infer insights from their changes across the autonomy stack in a reliable, and performant manner with faster iteration between the two stages. 

To that end, the DevX team at Zoox owns and maintains products that developers across the Perception, Prediction, Motion Planning, and release teams rely on in their day-to-day workflow. We are looking for Software Engineers with experience and an active interest in developing micro-services. You'll be working closely with the frontend developers to bring to life a performant product. If you are someone with a passion for developing performant APIs and are willing to take ownership and responsibility then you will be a great fit for the team.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Collision Avoidance System
description: The Collision Avoidance System (CAS) is responsible for detecting and reacting to imminent collision situations in support of our vehicle’s overall safety goals. CAS Perception is responsible for processing raw sensor data from our vehicle’s world-class sensor suite using a combination of geometric, interpretable algorithms and deep learning to detect near-collisions with obstacles along our intended driving path, in the most challenging dense urban environments and under tight compute resource constraints. Overall CAS is parallel and complementary to our Main AI autonomy stack, and has a close relationship with our vehicle hardware and safety teams in order to architect redundancy into our overall driving system.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Developer Platforms
description:
Delivering Zoox's mission of autonomous mobility primarily involves two stages - validating software in simulation before testing it in the real world and gathering insights from the data collected after real-world testing. The grand goal of the Developer Platforms team is to help developers at Zoox validate and infer insights from their changes across the autonomy stack in a reliable, and performant manner with faster iteration between the two stages. 

To that end, the DevX team at Zoox owns and maintains products that developers across the Perception, Prediction, Motion Planning, and release teams rely on in their day-to-day workflow. We are looking for Software Engineers with experience and an active interest in building web-based products with intuitive frontends and performant microservices. You'll be working closely with the customers from the requirements gathering phase all the way to the maintenance phase. If you are someone with a passion for web development and are willing to take ownership and responsibility then you will be a great fit for the team.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Front-End Simulation & Visualization
description:
Zoox is looking for software engineers to help us build front-end for simulation & validation framework. This framework enables the ability to manage a massive number of simulation scenarios and suites, configure, execute, and inspect large scale simulation runs, and present results that enable users to annotate, triage, and learn at a massive scale

If you enjoy working with fellow engineers and users to come up with new systems to boost their productivity in ways they didn't even know possible, we'd love to talk to you!

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - High Performance Computing Infrastructure
description: Zoox is looking for a software engineer to work on our custom High Performance Computing infrastructure and its supporting ecosystem of tools and services. This infrastructure is central to development workflows across all Zoox software divisions, from data engineering to computer vision perception to simulation and more. You will take on a breadth of end-to-end responsibilities including distributed system design, algorithmic job scheduling, and adaptive cloud scaling in support of all of Zoox’s computational needs.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Localization and Mapping Algorithms
description: Zoox is looking for a software engineer to help us build state-of-the-art mapping pipelines that combine data from a wide variety of sensors as well as localization algorithms that make use of these maps in real time. We're looking for an engineer with an advanced degree and experience building mapping and localization systems that work with real data in uncertain environments.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Localization and Mapping Backend Infrastructure
description: Our Calibration, Localization, and Mapping (CLAMS) team is responsible for building the algorithms and tools necessary for keeping Zoox vehicles well calibrated, always knowing where they’re located within the world, and aware of their environment. Without precise calibration, localization, and mapping our vehicles would be at a disadvantage when it comes to perceiving and reasoning about the surrounding world, and is therefore foundational in enabling results from many other teams across Zoox. This work is critical for scaling autonomous driving in a safe and reliable way. We are looking for engineers who are ambitious and excited about helping Zoox deliver on its goals to deliver autonomous mobility.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Machine Learning
description:
At Zoox, you will collaborate with a team of world-class engineers with diverse backgrounds in areas such as AI, robotics, mechatronics, planning, control, localization, computer vision, rendering, simulation, distributed computing, design, and automated testing. You’ll master new technologies while working on code, algorithms, and research in your area of expertise to create and refine key systems and move Zoox forward. 

Working at a startup gives you the chance to manifest your creativity and highly impact the final product.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Motion Planning
description: Decision making and motion planning are the primary responsibilities of mobile robots. Taking input from a variety of perception and localization systems, the planner's job is to figure out where the robot is going and how to get there safely.  We're looking for a software engineer with an advanced degree and experience building real-time motion planning/trajectory generation algorithms for robots in uncertain environments.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Operational Tools
description:
Zoox is looking for software engineers to build the tools that power our autonomous ride sharing service. Our Operational Tools Team is a crucial part of Zoox’s mission to deliver autonomous ride-hailing to the world.
We're building a team of highly collaborative and talented people with a diverse set of expertise. If you’re passionate about building great software that’s crucial to solving the biggest engineering challenge of our time, we'd love to chat!

Fleet Management Tools:
Role: Develop a scalable fleet management system that allows Zoox to remotely monitor and command our rapidly growing fleet of autonomous robotaxis. 
More Info: https://jobs.lever.co/zoox/501706f9-e907-4b79-9e48-a52596bb08d6

Realtime In-vehicle Visualization:
Role: Develop Zoox’s core in-vehicle visualization system, inventing innovative 3D visuals that allow our operators to understand and validate what the robot sees and thinks. 
More Info: https://jobs.lever.co/zoox/7ed54a39-60f2-488e-86c1-df405620b73f

L5 Robot Tools:
Role: Develop Zoox’s core operating interface for our purpose-built autonomous robotaxi. Best For: Anyone who thrives in ambiguity, has some experience in multiple domains and has a willingness to learn Zoox or AV-specific concepts. If you like working across domains, and have a passion for working on the bleeding edge, this is the role for you! 
More Info: https://jobs.lever.co/zoox/8297e627-6dcd-4947-a14f-83657c382b69

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Perception
description:
Zoox is looking for a software engineer to join our Perception team and help us build novel architectures for classifying and understanding the complex and dynamic environments in our cities. In this role, you will have access to the best sensor data in the world and an incredible infrastructure for testing and validating your algorithms. We are creating new algorithms for segmentation, tracking, classification, and high-level scene understanding, and you could work on any (or all!) of these components. 

We're looking for engineers with advanced degrees and experience building perception pipelines that work with real data in rapidly changing and uncertain environments.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Perception Machine Learning Infrastructure
description: You will be part of a team deploying state-of-the-art AI solutions for the Zoox autonomous driving Perception stack. In this role you will be responsible for scaling up systems to train state-of-the-art models on PBs of multimodal data. Your work will have a broad impact on performance and maintainability of models deployed on-vehicle as well as large offline models built to be used for data mining and auto labeling. Think you have what it takes to build the best machine learning systems on this planet? Come join us!

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Prediction
description: The Prediction team is responsible for forecasting the future state of all the dynamic agents around our vehicle. To account for the inherent uncertainty of predicting the future, our job is to compute a probabilistic representation over the future intentions and movement of other agents. The output from our Prediction system is then tightly integrated into our Planning system to deliver a safe and comfortable ride.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Robot Data Platform
description: Zoox is looking for a data platform software engineer to help build out the infrastructure and tools that manage our pipeline of vehicle data and telemetry. This pipeline is central to development workflows across all of our software. This role will have end-to-end responsibility for capturing, validating, storing, querying, and serving robot data.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Architecture
description:
Simulation is essential for Zoox to rapidly iterate on our driving software and hardware, and to validate our safety before we drive in the real world. We create virtual worlds to challenge our robots, from real world data, entirely novel scenarios, or a combination of both. Our simulations need to run at a huge scale to cover everything that might happen, and to help prove our driving to be safe.

As a simulation core engineer you build the architecture on which simulation relies - from the fundamental concepts of the simulated world, through to how simulation interacts with the whole software and hardware stack at Zoox. Our success depends on you building solid foundations which enable rapid and efficient development by all our teams, inside and outside of simulation.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Data Platform
description:
Zoox is looking for senior developers (5+ years experience) to build an insanely scalable platform using microservices, cloud databases and message queues. This mission critical platform will store and serve the simulation metadata and results, integrate with other systems, and provide extremely performant APIs for building a sophisticated UI product. 

This is an ideal opportunity for an innovative Software Engineer to build the foundation that can handle the exponential growth of data and at the same time meet the complex use cases for its consumption.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Infrastructure
description:
Simulation is essential to Zoox’s mission. Zoox uses simulation to develop our driving software, validate our safety, and analyze our real world performance. Our team’s work directly impacts how rapidly and successfully Zoox will achieve its goals.

Our team’s mission is to provide the simulation framework and tools for Zoox to rapidly develop our hardware and software, and to help answer the ultimate question: "Is Zoox’s robot safe to drive on our cities’ streets?"

Learn more about our Simulation team

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Infrastructure
description:
Simulation is essential to Zoox’s mission. Zoox uses simulation to develop our driving software, validate our safety, and analyze our real world performance. Our team’s work directly impacts how rapidly and successfully Zoox will achieve its goals.

Our team’s mission is to provide the simulation framework and tools for Zoox to rapidly develop our hardware and software, and to help answer the ultimate question: "Is Zoox’s robot safe to drive on our cities’ streets?"

Learn more about our Simulation team

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Operations
description:
The Zoox simulation team has a critical mission: to be able to answer the question, "Is Zoox's autonomous driving software safe?"  This work is critical for scaling autonomous driving in a safe and reliable way, and we run millions of simulations every week.

You will be a key member of the simulation team, helping to ensure reliability and scalability of the simulation framework. You will work cross-functionally, with other simulation engineers and the QA and infrastructure teams, to monitor and improve our validation pipelines and services so that they remain efficient and reliable as we run ever-increasing numbers of simulations.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Operations
description:
The Zoox simulation team has a critical mission: to be able to answer the question, "Is Zoox's autonomous driving software safe?"  This work is critical for scaling autonomous driving in a safe and reliable way, and we run millions of simulations every week.

You will be a key member of the simulation team, helping to ensure reliability and scalability of the simulation framework. You will work cross-functionally, with other simulation engineers and the QA and infrastructure teams, to monitor and improve our validation pipelines and services so that they remain efficient and reliable as we run ever-increasing numbers of simulations.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Release Engineer
description:
The Zoox simulation team has a critical mission: to be able to answer the question, "Is Zoox's autonomous driving software safe?"  This work is critical for scaling autonomous driving in a safe and reliable way. 

You will be a key member of the simulation team, helping to deliver new versions of the simulation framework reliably and efficiently. You will also work cross functionally, with other build/release engineers and the QA and infrastructure teams, to integrate the simulation framework into a release process to validate our safety critical autonomous vehicle software.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Scenario Editor
description: Do you enjoy creating intuitive interfaces that makes complicated systems easy to understand and use? Are you interested in applying your skills to build tools for testing and ensuring the safety of autonomous vehicles? The Simulation team at Zoox is looking for you to work on our Scenario Editor tool, and enable creation of scenarios of all kinds that capture the challenges of real world driving.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Scenario Generation
description: Simulation is essential for Zoox to rapidly iterate on our driving software and hardware, and to validate our safety before we drive in the real world. Come join the team that provides the virtual worlds in which our robots can revisit what we’ve seen in real world testing, be exposed to infinite variations of it, or can even experience entirely new scenarios!

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Scenario Generation
description: Simulation is essential for Zoox to rapidly iterate on our driving software and hardware, and to validate our safety before we drive in the real world. Come join the team that provides the virtual worlds in which our robots can revisit what we’ve seen in real world testing, be exposed to infinite variations of it, or can even experience entirely new scenarios!

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Traffic & Behavior Modeling
description:
Simulation is essential to Zoox’s mission. Zoox uses simulation to develop our driving software, validate safety, and analyze our real-world performance. Our team’s work directly impacts how rapidly and successfully Zoox will achieve its goals.

For our simulators to successfully validate our autonomous driving stack, we need to realistically model and replicate the worlds we will be driving in. This includes modeling and simulating human behaviors, specifically traffic and other pedestrian behaviors. The challenge is that the simulated humans need to show realistic and representative behavior — we want our agents to jaywalk as a human might do, and also replicate a wide range of behaviors that we encounter while driving in real cities.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulation Workload Orchestration
description:
Come join us at Zoox to participate in the transportation revolution with building self-driving vehicles! Our mission is to make personal transportation safer, cleaner, and more enjoyable for everyone. Simulation is essential to Zoox’s mission. Zoox uses simulation to develop our driving software, validate safety, and analyze our real-world performance. Our team’s work directly impacts how rapidly and successfully Zoox will achieve its goals. 

We are looking for experienced developers (5+ years experience) to build a massively scalable pipeline for orchestrating the execution of simulations and processing of the results. This mission critical pipeline will be highly parallel, manage various stages of execution, ensure correct data flow and coordinate the processing of the results. This is an ideal opportunity for an innovative Software Engineer to build the foundation and the pipeline that can exponentially scale up the execution of the simulations and at the same time meet the diverse needs of processing the results.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulator
description:
Simulation is essential to Zoox’s mission. Zoox uses simulation to develop our driving software, validate our safety, and analyze our real world performance. Our team’s work directly impacts how rapidly and successfully Zoox will achieve its goals.

Our team’s mission is to provide the simulation framework and tools for Zoox to rapidly develop our hardware and software, and to help answer the ultimate question: "Is Zoox’s robot safe to drive on our cities’ streets?"

Learn more about our Simulation team

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Simulator
description:
Simulation is essential to Zoox’s mission. Zoox uses simulation to develop our driving software, validate our safety, and analyze our real world performance. Our team’s work directly impacts how rapidly and successfully Zoox will achieve its goals.

Learn more about our Simulation team

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - Software Systems Infrastructure
description:
The Software Systems Infrastructure team is responsible for defining SW development processes and ensuring that all safety-critical software meets a high safety bar for production vehicles.

In this role, you will help establish infrastructure, design and develop software tools that will automate, track or audit processes and methods needed to build safety-critical software, that will revolutionize transportation in the 21st century. Borrowing principles from avionics, automotive, and other safety-critical industries, you will work with software engineers and systems engineers across the Zoox software org, ranging from state-of-the-art AI Perception, all the way to highly-critical RTOS and middleware components.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer - UI for TeleGuidance
description:
The TeleGuidance team at Zoox enables our autonomous vehicles to incorporate human contextual guidance into the planning algorithms allowing our vehicles to successfully reason about and navigate complex scenarios by leveraging real time remote human guidance. TeleGuidance is an integral part of the self driving stack, dealing with some of the most challenging scenarios by fusing the “human sensor” data in real time to plan a solution to complete the mission. 

Take a look at this video we made for a more thorough explanation from the hiring manager: https://youtu.be/NKQHuutVx78

There are three major domains within the team to allow this: starting with the on vehicle planning algorithms that incorporate the human guidance, to the complex adapting network infrastructure and finally the 3D interface which the remote operators use to gain situational awareness and send guidance to the autonomous fleet. 

In this role you will contribute to building the essential user interface which the remote operators use to provide guidance to the autonomous fleet. This mission critical interface is the primary means of enabling the human-machine collaboration by providing a real time 3D view of the environment and live video feeds allowing the operators to gain situational awareness, and provide guidance. You will have an impact on the interface for new guidance features and tackle the challenges of virtually enabling an operator to comprehend the complex driving scene.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer, Mission Planning
description:
The Mission Planner team at Zoox is responsible for generating the high level route our autonomous vehicles will take to transport passengers to their destination. By working closely with our cloud services team to facilitate pickup and drop off requests along with live traffic data among other inputs, and integrating closely with the decision making and trajectory planning and controls teams to allow dynamic planning this team will enable the core ability for our vehicles to choose the best routes through cities and adapt in real time. 

We are looking for an engineer who is excited to solve the complexities of mission planning in dynamic cities, by contributing novel solutions to the architecture and design and driven to take ownership of major software components. If you like to work close to the robot platform and enjoy experiencing your developed software in the robot, we would like to hear from you.

title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer, Ride & Fleet Services
description:
The ride and fleet backend team is looking for a backend Software Engineer/Tech Lead to build out the backend services that are responsible for ensuring that we are efficiently dispatching missions to our robots and providing top-notch rider and vehicle operator experience across mobile apps, robots, and web apps.
 
Zoox robots take missions like Rideshare Trips, Charging, Cleaning, and support rider interactions like Authentication, Ingress, and Egress. It is the backbone of our autonomous fleet management system and the brains behind connecting our riders and vehicle operators to our robots.

title: Senior/Staff Technical Program Manager - Software
description:
Zoox has embarked on a highly ambitious journey to develop a full-stack autonomous mobility solution for our cities. As a technical program manager, you will work cross-functionally with engineering leaders across software, hardware, vehicle engineering, and product to drive our corporate strategy into tactical and detailed road maps that facilitate effective execution at each stage of our growth curve. You will work with each engineering team to develop project schedules, identify milestones, flag risks, estimate budgets, and clearly communicate ongoing progress. 

Please note, below are general requirements relevant to all of our software TPM openings. We are hiring many TPMs within our software org, to work with teams like Motion Planning & Control, Firmware, Localization, Mapping etc. Your specific skillset will be matched with the appropriate internal team.

title: Sensor Software Developer
description: We seek a highly skilled and experienced software developer to join our team. The Software Sensors group is responsible for developing the drivers for the lidar, radar, and camera sensors on the vehicle, which are critical components for the perception and planning stack. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development and be able to design, implement, and maintain high-quality, robust code that meets the vehicle's specific use/safety case.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test
description:
Autonomous vehicles have some of the largest, most complex software ever shipped in a safety-critical environment. Solving that problem is one of the most exciting technical challenges of our lifetime.

The Software Quality Assurance team at Zoox has a critical set of responsibilities, from AI validation to internal tools test automation. As a Sr. Software Development Engineer in Test on our team, you will take a leadership role in driving forward technical advancements in test frameworks and tools. You will implement and develop test automation frameworks, implement new solutions to technical test problems, and build novel tools for our teams to utilize. You will be a force multiplier by mentoring other test engineers and growing their test design and coding capabilities.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test - Embedded Systems
description: The Software Development Engineer in Test is responsible for designing, implementing, and tracking progress of firmware validation tests. This role requires a candidate passionate about learning how things work to the point of breaking them.  The ideal candidate has proven experience testing complex embedded systems in a team environment focused on firmware behaviors.  Our team uses Software Engineering best practices to validate firmware with automation.  Join us if you want to develop cutting edge and state of the art automation techniques in the exciting autonomous vehicle industry!

title: Software Development Engineer in Test - Embedded Systems
description: The Software Development Engineer in Test is responsible for designing, implementing, and tracking progress of firmware validation tests. This role requires a candidate passionate about learning how things work to the point of breaking them.  The ideal candidate has proven experience testing complex embedded systems in a team environment focused on firmware behaviors.  Our team uses Software Engineering best practices to validate firmware with automation.  Join us if you want to develop cutting edge and state of the art automation techniques in the exciting autonomous vehicle industry!

title: Software Engineer - Autonomy Metrics
description:
Decision making and motion planning are the primary responsibilities of mobile robots. Taking input from a variety of perception and localization systems, the planner's job is to figure out where the robot is going and how to get there safely. 

A key piece of building this complex software is measuring its performance. As a software engineer for autonomy metrics, you will use vehicle and simulation data to help our developers understand how the vehicle is driving. You should be passionate about developing innovative metrics for driving behavior and/or system performance that support decisions, direct efforts, and provide clarity.

title: Software Engineer - Autonomy Metrics
description:

You should be passionate about developing innovative metrics for driving behavior and/or system performance that support decisions, direct efforts, and provide clarity.

title: Software Engineer - Calibration
description: Our Calibration, Localization, and Mapping (CLAMS) team is responsible for building the algorithms and tools necessary for keeping Zoox vehicles well calibrated, always knowing where they’re located within the world, and aware of their environment. Without precise calibration, localization, and mapping our vehicles would be at a disadvantage when it comes to perceiving and reasoning about the surrounding world, and is therefore foundational in enabling results from many other teams across Zoox. This work is critical for scaling autonomous driving in a safe and reliable way. We are looking for engineers who are ambitious and excited about helping Zoox deliver on its goals to deliver autonomous mobility.

title: Software Engineer - Developer Experience - Returnship
description:
The Path Forward Return-to-Work program at Zoox is a 16-week paid returnship for experienced professionals returning to the workforce. The program is open to individuals who have at least five years of professional experience and have been out of the paid workforce for at least two years to focus on caregiving of any kind. If you meet these criteria, we welcome you to apply.

Zoox is excited to welcome returners because we appreciate the skills you can offer, the perspective you provide, and the contributions you will make. This program offers you a chance to revamp your skills, gain new experience, and make connections with others transitioning back to the workforce. It also offers support through Path Forward, a non-profit organization on a mission to empower people who’ve been focused on caregiving to transition back to the paid workforce. 

We are looking for a software engineer who will be responsible for solving challenging developer productivity problems at scale, building distributed systems, and scaling state-of-the-art algorithms. In this role, you will be working with cutting-edge hardware and pushing systems to their limits. Zoox is a robotics company and our ethos of automation extends throughout the infrastructure components we build.

title: Software Engineer - HD Mapping Algorithms
description: Our Calibration, Localization, and Mapping (CLAMS) team is responsible for building the algorithms and tools necessary for keeping Zoox vehicles well calibrated, always knowing where they’re located within the world, and aware of their environment. title: Software Engineer - iOS
description: Zoox is looking for a skilled iOS engineer to join the Mobile Apps team within our Ride & Fleet Software Engineering organization. This is a high impact position with the opportunity to drive large cross-functional projects that will shape the riders’ interface into our autonomous ride hailing service. Your work will be highly visible, at the forefront of our service rollout. In your development work, and in interactions with a wide variety of teams at Zoox, we will expect you to be essential in engineering design and implementation that results in a robust, usable, and secure system: from Rider, to Cloud, to Robot.

title: Software Engineer - Machine Learning Platform
description:
Zoox’s Machine Learning Platform team operates in the intersection of build engineering, internal software development, and applied ML research. We maintain the base layer of ML tools and deep learning frameworks used by the research teams, add additional features, tooling, automation, and applications, and improve ML models in collaboration with the applied research teams. We advocate for strong software engineering fundamentals with our customer teams.  We catalogue the features, quirks, limitations, and bugs present in the systems we maintain so that we can best advise our customer teams when they encounter them.

ML Platform is looking for focused, proactive senior-to-staff software engineers.  By joining our team, you will design and deliver a performant, comprehensive platform for ML research and development to our internal customers. You will improve the production deployment mechanisms used for on- and off-vehicle inference. You will work with teams from IT, build and release, and cluster management on projects to advance our mission. You will provide technical leadership to the team and mentor new hires. People management opportunities will be available as the team grows.

title: Software Engineer - Motion Planning Collision Avoidance
description: Zoox is looking for a safety-critical software engineer to join our Planning and Control team. In this role, you will be responsible for bringing cutting edge motion planning and control systems towards high standard safety ratings. This is a multidisciplinary role that will get you exposed to safety-critical system engineering, perception, prediction, and embedded computing. You will lead the effort redefining what cutting-edge AI software can do in high-mission-assurance environments.

title: Software Engineer - Optimization
description: Zoox is looking for a person to join our Perception Optimization team to work on perception system profiling and optimization. You will work closely with research engineers on the perception team over the full development life cycle from algorithm design to model deployment on autonomous vehicles.

title: Software Engineer - Perception Machine Learning Infrastructure
description: You will be part of a team deploying state-of-the-art AI solutions for the Zoox autonomous driving Perception stack. In this role you will be responsible for scaling up systems to train state-of-the-art models on PBs of multimodal data. Your work will have a broad impact on performance and maintainability of models deployed on-vehicle as well as large offline models built to be used for data mining and auto labeling. Think you have what it takes to build the best machine learning systems on this planet? Come join us!

title: Software Engineer - Perception Metrics Platform
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Metrics Platform Engineer/Architect to design and develop a metric platform for the Perception component of our autonomous driving stack. As a member of the Perception team, you will be part of the “eyes and ears” of the Zoox autonomous driving stack, deploying state-of-the-art AI solutions to ensure safe and effective driving.

In this role, you will work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and software engineers to build a scalable and high-performance platform that enables perception engineers to efficiently evaluate their models across PBs of multimodal data. You will be responsible for guiding the design of our data pipelines and related MLOps systems, ensuring that they follow best practices and increase the efficiency, safety, and accuracy of not only Perception, but Zoox’s autonomous driving stack as a whole. 

Think you have what it takes to build the best machine learning systems on this planet? Come join us!

title: Software Engineer - Rider Support Tools
description: Zoox is looking for a software engineer to help build our full-stack web-based platform for rider support operations. These internal tools are critical to the roll out of our robotaxi service. They will ensure that riders have a safe and enjoyable ride experience, provide quick and efficient support when necessary, and collect feedback and metrics to improve our autonomous driving business. You will work closely with autonomous driving software engineers and vehicle engineers to design feature-rich applications and identify new opportunities for internal tools at Zoox.

title: Software Engineer - Road Network Mapping
description:
Zoox's Road Network team is responsible for developing the tools and infrastructure necessary to build, curate, and manage our high definition road network.

This road network is critical to autonomous driving and contains the semantic map information that our fleet uses to navigate real streets in multiple cities, with centimeter precision, every day. Our engineers’ work is foundational to driving autonomously, enabling many other AI teams in the Software org, as well as an internal team of Cartographers (map creators). The ZRN team treats our maps as a living data product, promptly shipping content updates whenever the world changes.

Our ZRN engineers drive architectural decisions about our map lifecycle. We create data pipelines and tools that make it easy for the entire business to access and understand our map data.

Our ideal software engineer is passionate about building systems to deliver maps rapidly, accurately, and at scale. Our team will help Zoox become a national mobility-as-a-service platform.

We are a small agile team of engineers and cartographers, passionate about code quality and maps. If any of the roles below interest you, we’d love to chat with you!

title: Software Engineer - Road Network Web Back-End
description:
Zoox's Road Network team is responsible for developing the tools and infrastructure necessary to build, curate, and manage our high definition road network.

To achieve these goals, ZRN has built several web applications that enable us to visualize, inspect, and validate the semantic road data. Our back-end engineers support both internal content pipeline services and the underlying frameworks and services used by major tools across the company, including our fleet management, log viewing, and simulation tools. We’re just getting started, and we have many more tools we can’t wait to build as we develop our web team.

We are looking for senior candidates with strong back-end or full-stack experience who are excited to shape the future and destiny of our web tools. We use Typescript in most of our front-end applications and C++/Python on the back-end.

title: Software Engineer - Safety Learnings
description:
The Safety Learnings Engineer will be responsible for analyzing field events for potential safety issues, prioritizing safety learnings, and partnering cross-functionally to develop and implement pragmatic requirements or solutions. In doing so, you will work closely with Software (Planner, Perception, Firmware), Operations, Vehicle Engineering, Safety Design, Hardware, and Legal teams to ensure a rigorous, disciplined, risk-based approach.

This position will require the ability to build strong relationships and build stakeholder consensus in working towards novel safety solutions to mitigate risk.  A successful candidate will be able to work “in the weeds” closely with other software engineers to identify, triage, and implement changes to safety-critical code.  This candidate should also be able to support an on-call incident management process, and contribute to Safety Management System, Safety Planning, Compliance and Policy activities.

title: Software Engineer - Simulation - Frontend/Full-Stack - Returnship
description:
The Path Forward Return-to-Work program at Zoox is a 16-week paid returnship for experienced professionals returning to the workforce. The program is open to individuals who have at least five years of professional experience and have been out of the paid workforce for at least two years to focus on caregiving of any kind. If you meet these criteria, we welcome you to apply.

Zoox is excited to welcome returners because we appreciate the skills you can offer, the perspective you provide, and the contributions you will make. This program offers you a chance to revamp your skills, gain new experience, and make connections with others transitioning back to the workforce. It also offers support through Path Forward, a non-profit organization on a mission to empower people who’ve been focused on caregiving to transition back to the paid workforce. 

We are looking for software engineers to help us build front-end for simulation & validation framework. This framework enables the ability to manage a massive number of simulation scenarios and suites, configure, execute, and inspect large scale simulation runs, and present results that enable users to annotate, triage, and learn at a massive scale. 

If you enjoy working with fellow engineers and users to come up with new systems to boost their productivity in ways they didn't even know possible, we'd love to talk to you!

title: Software Engineer - Simulation Architecture
description:
Simulation is essential for Zoox to rapidly iterate on our driving software and hardware, and to validate our safety before we drive in the real world. We create virtual worlds to challenge our robots, from real world data, entirely novel scenarios, or a combination of both. Our simulations need to run at a huge scale to cover everything that might happen, and to help prove our driving to be safe.

As a simulation core engineer you build the architecture on which simulation relies - from the fundamental concepts of the simulated world, through to how simulation interacts with the whole software and hardware stack at Zoox. Our success depends on you building solid foundations which enable rapid and efficient development by all our teams, inside and outside of simulation.

title: Software Engineer - Synthetic Data
description: Accurately perceiving the world is foundational to autonomous driving. To support this, the Zoox Simulation team is looking for experienced engineers to build multi-sensor synthetic data for training our perception ML models using our in-house 3D engine.  You will collaborate with ML researchers, technical artists, and simulation engineers to build synthetic data, rapidly iterating to teach our robot how to perceive the real world.

title: Software Engineer - Synthetic Data
description: Accurately perceiving the world is foundational to autonomous driving. To support this, the Zoox Simulation team is looking for experienced engineers to build multi-sensor synthetic data for training our perception ML models using our in-house 3D engine.  You will collaborate with ML researchers, technical artists, and simulation engineers to build synthetic data, rapidly iterating to teach our robot how to perceive the real world.

title: Software Engineer, C++ System Software Architecture
description:
Shipping the software that powers Zoox's revolutionary autonomous vehicles is an extremely challenging job. Software architecture engineers act as a multiplier for the entire software organization, looking for opportunities to make our software and engineering teams more efficient and productive. They frequently tackle big challenges in the code base that cut across multiple teams. Additionally, they provide technical leadership and design review services to the rest of the software organization. Zoox's software architecture engineers see the entire safety critical autonomous driving stack from a 10,000-foot view, but frequently zoom in and get their hands dirty solving problems with the biggest payoff across all of the software teams.

We're looking for engineers with strong software engineering skills and broad experience, but with a focus in C++ systems-level software. Candidates should also be comfortable hacking out quick scripts to automate tasks when necessary. Autonomous vehicles have some of the largest, most complex software ever shipped in a safety-critical environment; solving that problem is one of the most exciting technical challenges of our lifetime.

title: Software Engineer, Firmware Security
description:
The Security Software Development & Analysis (SSDA) team is a subteam within ProdSec aiming at improving the security posture of Zoox robotaxi service through:
Development of security-critical software for vehicle platform & backend infrastructure
Development of software for security monitoring & analytics
Providing security guidance to software teams through architecture reviews, threat analysis, risk assessment, and development of reference implementations of security features

title: Software Engineer, Platforms Software Security
description:
The Security Software Development & Analysis (SSDA) team is a subteam within ProdSec aiming at improving the security posture of Zoox robotaxi service through:
Development of security-critical software for vehicle platform & backend infrastructure
Development of software for security monitoring & analytics
Providing security guidance to software teams through architecture reviews, threat analysis, risk assessment, and development of reference implementations of security features

title: Software Engineer, Secure Embedded Operating Systems
description:
Zoox's Robot Software Infrastructure team is looking for a motivated software engineer to help mature the operating system on our vehicle’s primary compute platform. In addition to operating systems, the Robot Software Infrastructure team is responsible for vehicle software updates, and works on security-focused software in close collaboration with the product security team.
In this role, you’ll work on software that connects networks, drivers, artificial intelligence software, build systems, and web services. If you are excited to explore a broad problem space and are mindful of how components fit within a larger system, you may be a great fit! Ideally you will be able to work remotely, on-site, and occasionally in a vehicle.

title: Software Engineer, Security Analysis & Assurance
description:
The Security Software Development & Analysis (SSDA) team is a subteam within ProdSec aiming at improving the security posture of Zoox robotaxi service through the development of security-critical software for vehicle platform & backend infrastructure. Including defining security requirements for individual vehicle components as well as their integrated subsystems. Engineers will also be responsible for 
developing software tools, frameworks, and processes for constructing security assurance cases; providing evidence & grounds for confidence that a set of intended security controls on vehicle subsystems are effective in their application.

title: Software Manager, Systems Engineering and Integration
description: In this role, you will be responsible for leading a team to deliver systems collateral for an autonomous vehicle.  You will have deep experience in complex software systems. You will lead a team to deliver software tooling to measure metrics such as e2e latency, power consumption, CPU/GPU/networking performance metrics, configuration management, and related diagnostics. You will work with engineering leaders across hardware, embedded firmware, software, and vehicle teams to align on the delivery of tooling and metrics.

title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer - System Behavior
description:
Autonomous vehicles have some of the largest, most complex software ever shipped in a safety-critical environment. Solving that problem is one of the most exciting technical challenges of our lifetime.

As a Software Quality Assurance Engineer focused on systems behavior analysis, you will play a critical role in the development of Zoox's autonomous platform. You'll work with a broad set of engineering teams across Zoox to identify issues. You will help triage and root cause these issues and analyze the test results to ensure there are no regressions with our platform. You will also produce test reports and commentary that informs leadership on the overall quality and helps drive engineering decisions. Your ability to distill complex systems and root cause issues will be critical to producing a safe and stable vehicle platform.

title: Software Systems Engineer
description:
The Software Systems Engineering team is responsible for defining SW development processes and ensuring that all safety-critical software meets a high safety bar for production vehicles.

In this role, you will help design and manage processes, methods, and other artifacts needed to build safety-critical software, that will revolutionize transportation in the 21st century. Borrowing principles from avionics, automotive, and other safety-critical industries, you will work with software engineers throughout the Zoox software org, ranging from state-of-the-art AI Perception, all the way to highly-critical RTOS and middleware components.

title: Software Systems Engineer - Software Health and Complexity
description:
The Software Systems Engineering team is responsible for defining SW development processes and ensuring that all safety-critical software meets a high safety bar for production vehicles.

In this role, you will help design and manage processes, methods, and other artifacts needed to build safety-critical software, that will revolutionize transportation in the 21st century. Borrowing principles from avionics, automotive, and other safety-critical industries, you will work with software engineers throughout the Zoox software org, ranging from state-of-the-art AI Perception, all the way to highly-critical RTOS and middleware components.

title: Staff Software Engineer - Autonomy Integration
description: Zoox is transitioning from research and development to an operational business with a public-facing product. As we are expanding our fully driverless geofences, the integration efforts of the onboard autonomy software becomes more complex. In this position you will lead those integration efforts which span across the overall onboard driving software (perception, prediction, planning, control, localization). We are looking for somebody who has the “desire to ship” and have a big impact. This role gives you high visibility within the company and is critical for successfully launching our autonomous driving software.

title: Technical Program Manager - Software
description:
Zoox has embarked on a highly ambitious journey to develop a full-stack autonomous mobility solution for our cities. As a technical program manager, you will work cross-functionally with engineering leaders across software, hardware, vehicle engineering, and product to drive our corporate strategy into tactical and detailed road maps that facilitate effective execution at each stage of our growth curve. You will work with each engineering team to develop project schedules, identify milestones, flag risks, estimate budgets, and clearly communicate ongoing progress. 

Please note, below are general requirements relevant to all of our software TPM openings. We are hiring many TPMs within our software org, to work with teams like Motion Planning & Control, Firmware, Localization, Mapping etc. Your specific skillset will be matched with the appropriate internal team.

Working at Atlassian

description:

We are the Jira Frontend Platform team focusing primarily on Developer Productivity. Atlassian is looking for a Frontend Engineer to build our web frontend systems and tools that allow our Jira product teams to deliver great experiences to our users.

Your team will play a crucial role in the Jira Frontend platform strategy.
